definition: fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
(negative prefix)/not/no
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: None of the great composers had a more unfortunate talent-to-luck ratio than Franz Schubert.
sentences.chinese: 從沒有一個偉大的作曲家像舒伯特那樣的時運不濟。

sentences.english: The moles and birthmarks in these areas can indicate good fortune, or a lack of it.
sentences.chinese: 痣或胎記落到這些區域有可能象徵好運或時運不濟。

sentences.english: It worked against Forlan. It should work in favor of Suarez.
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭時運不濟，但現在的時機非常適合蘇亞雷斯。

sentences.english: To all appearances he was just the commonplace planter who had fallen upon evil days .
sentences.chinese: 表面上看來，他完全是個時運不濟的普通種植園主。

definition: lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
protective coloration/camouflage
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
powerless to defend oneself (idiom); helpless
female gossip/busybody
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
